extendedIngredients.original: 1 to 2 canned chipotle chiles in adobo, minced, plus 2 to 3 teaspoons adobo sauce

title: Baked Shrimp in Chipotle Sauce
summary: Baked Shrimp in Chipotle Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4. One serving contains 464 calories, 41g of protein, and 16g of fat. For $4.32 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. If you have worcestershire sauce, garlic clove, wine, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 48%, this dish is solid. Try Shrimp with Chipotle-Lime Dipping Sauce, Popcorn Shrimp with Mango Chipotle Sauce, and Shrimp Tacos with Chipotle Lime Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Preheat oven to 400°F.                                                                Melt butter in a saucepan and stir in wine, Worcestershire sauce, chipotles, adobo sauce, garlic, and salt. Toss shrimp with sauce in a large shallow baking dish and bake in middle of oven until shrimp are just cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes.                                                Cooks' note:            Shrimp with heads on may be used in this recipe — you'll need 1 pound.

steps.step: Melt butter in a saucepan and stir in wine, Worcestershire sauce, chipotles, adobo sauce, garlic, and salt. Toss shrimp with sauce in a large shallow baking dish and bake in middle of oven until shrimp are just cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes.
Shrimp with heads on may be used in this recipe — you'll need 1 pound.
